'''Defence Intelligence and Security Centre''' (DISC) is the location of the Headquarters of both the Defence College of Intelligence and the [[British Army]] [[Intelligence Corps (United Kingdom)|Intelligence Corps]]. It is located at [[Chicksands]], [[Bedfordshire]], approximately {{convert|35|mi|km}} north of [[London]].
==Site History==
{{main| RAF Chicksands}}
Chicksands was the site of [[Royal Air force|RAF]] Chicksands, an RAF [[Signals Intelligence|signals collection]] station during and after World War II; during the war it was one of the "Y-Stations" which sent intercepted signals to the [[Government Communications Headquarters#Government Code and Cypher School (GCCS)|Government Code and Cypher School (GC&CS)]] at [[Bletchley Park]], where ciphers and codes of several [[Axis Powers|Axis]] countries were decrypted, most importantly the ciphers generated by the German [[Enigma (machine)|Enigma]] and [[Lorenz cipher|Lorenz]] machines. The station was used by the [[United States Air Force]] from 1950 to 1995, also for signals collection, being the location for its first {{convert|1443|ft|m}} diameter [[FLR-9]] direction finding antenna, commonly known as the Elephant Cage, from 1963 to 1995. The site was closed as an RAF station in 1997, then handed over to the [[Intelligence Corps (United Kingdom)|Intelligence Corps]] allowing the Corps Headquarters and training delivery to re-locate from Templer Barracks in [[Ashford, Kent|Ashford]], [[Kent]].
==Defence College of Intelligence==
The Defence college of Intelligence is responsible for delivering training in [[Military intelligence|intelligence]] and security to members of the [[British Armed Forces]], [[police]] and other public sector staff as well as international partners. Training is delivered over three sites, Chicksands, Defence School of Language [[Beaconsfield]] and the School of Photography at the [[DCAE Cosford|Defence College of Aeronautical Engineering, Cosford]].
==HQ Intelligence Corps==
The Headquarters of the Intelligence Corps is located on site, with all core training for Intelligence Corps soldiers and officers being delivered through the DCI.
==HMS Ferret==
{{HMS|Ferret|shore establishment 1982|6}} is a training unit of the [[Royal Naval Reserve]] which delivers Intelligence related operational capability.<ref>[http://www.royal-navy.mod.uk/server/show/nav.2953 HMS Ferret]</ref>
==15(UK) Psychological Operations Group (PSYOPS)==
15 Psychological Operations Group is a unit of the Intelligence Corps which contains personnel from all three UK armed forces. The unit supports deployed commanders in the provision of [[psychological operations]] in the operational and tactical environments. <ref> [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|MoD]] - [http://web.archive.org/web/20060620154544/http://www.army.mod.uk/15psyops/index.htm 15 (UK) Psychological Operations Group] </ref><ref> [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|MoD]] - [[Royal Navy]] - [http://www.royalnavy.mod.uk/psychological-ops-group Psychological Ops Group]</ref> Formerly known as 15 (UK) Information Support Group, it was codenamed [[Shadow]] in the mid-1990s.<ref>[http://www.psywar.org/psywar/reproductions/15POG_Annual_Report_2008.pdf 15 (United Kingdom) Psychological Operations Group: Annual Report]</ref><ref>S Jolly,"Wearing the Stag's Head Badge: British Combat Propaganda since 1945", ''Falling Leaf: The Journal of the Psywar Society'', 170: 86-89 (October 2000)</ref>
